docs.text: " love to kill " starts off aimlessly and gets progressively less coherent as time passes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at the outset , the movie appears to be about tony danza , who's an illegal distributor of guns , trying to establish a relationship with an unsuspecting woman .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: danza sets up a double date with her , her sister , and a collegue of his .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: everything seems to be going well , until the sister accidentally dies by falling down a set of stairs .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: much confusion and mahem ensues , as the death is covered up and other associates of danza's begin to emerge , all after one thing or another .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sound confusing ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it is .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i think what the filmmakers were trying to do is take the standard crime movie and throw in a little humour and levity .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in some respects , it works .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but the majority of the film is a convoluted and confusing mess .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: characters keep popping up with no explanation , demanding money for deals that occur off-screen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the only aspect of the movie that actually works is the budding relationship between danza and the dead woman's sister .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but so little time is devoted to this part of the story , we never really become too familiar with these characters , and because of this , we don't really care what happens to them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , i didn't , at least .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one thing i will give the movie is that it's a complete departure for tony danza .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here's a guy , because of his many sitcom roles , who's ingrained in the consciousness as a nice guy who always does the right thing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here , he plays a man who's just looking out for himself , and if that means he needs to kill in order to save his own skin , so be it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i was very impressed by his performance , and within minutes of the start of the film , i had forgotten all about his good-guy persona .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: michael madsen is also good as an associate of danza's who spends half the movie buddying up to him and the other half trying to kill him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: like i said , it's not exactly a linear storyline .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " love to kill " should be praised for trying to do something different with the well worn crime genre , but it's just too bad that the story doesn't really add up to much .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the stars deserved better , and so did the audience .
docs.label: negative
